title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 472.4 - Maximum gross weight of trailers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 472.4 - Maximum gross weight of trailers

State Regulations

Tax Law, § 501, subd. 4

The maximum gross weight of a trailer is the weight of
the trailer plus the maximum load to be carried by it on New York public
highways. Example 1: If the unloaded weight of a trailer is 10,200 pounds, and
the maximum load to be carried by it in New York is 38,800 pounds, its maximum
gross weight is 49,000 pounds. Example 2: If a special hauling permit is obtained from the

Department of Transportation authorizing a tractor and trailer to operate with
a maximum gross weight of 100,000 pounds (maximum gross weight of trailer is
48,000 pounds and unloaded weight of tractor is 12,000 pounds), the maximum
gross weight of the combination is 100,000 pounds, and the maximum gross weight
of the trailer is 88,000 pounds. (See §
481.4
[f]
infra. )
